com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.Gameobjects

Class MovableEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.Gameobjects.AbstractGameObject
      • com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.Gameobjects.AbstractEntity
        • com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.Gameobjects.MovableEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Telegraph, HasID, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BenchmarkBall, DestructionParticle, Particle, PlayerWithWeapon

    public class MovableEntity
extends AbstractEntity
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A clas used mainly for characters or object which can walk around. To control the character you should use a Controllable or modify the movemnet via setMovement(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from class: AbstractEntity
        Deletes the object from the map and every other container. The opposite to spawn() but removes it completely; makes it dissapear completely.
        Overrides:
        dispose in class AbstractEntity
        See Also:
        AbstractEntity.shouldBeDisposed(), AbstractEntity.disposeFromMap()

      • setWalkingAnimationCycling

        public void setWalkingAnimationCycling(boolean cycle)
        Bounce back and forth (1,2,3,2,1,2 etc.) or cycle (1,2,3,1,2,3 etc.)
        Parameters:
        cycle - true if cycle, false if bounce

      • setContinuousWalkingAnimation

        public void setContinuousWalkingAnimation(float walkOnTheSpot)
        Enable this to have a walking cycle even if not moving
        Parameters:
        walkOnTheSpot - the speed of the animation: ~1. To disable pass 0.

      • setWalkingStepMode

        public void setWalkingStepMode(boolean stepmode)
        Set step mode or disable step mode. if no step mode plays animation back and forth. If step mode then some strange pattern which looks god for walking animations.
        Parameters:
        stepmode - stepmode = true,

      • setMovement

        public void setMovement(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 movement)
        Sets speed and direction.
        Parameters:
        movement - containing direction and speed in m/s without the unit e.g. for 5m/s use just 5 and not 5*Block.GAME_EDGELENGTH.

      • addToHor

        public void addToHor(float speed)
        Adds speed to horizontal moving directio.
        Parameters:
        speed - speed in m/s without the unit so no "5*#GAME_EDGELENGTH" for 5 m/s but just "5".

      • setFriction

        public void setFriction(float friction)
        Automatically slows speed down.
        Parameters:
        friction - The higher the value, the less "slide". If =0 friciton is disabled. Value should be ~0.01f

      • pauseMovementAnimation

        public void pauseMovementAnimation()
        Pauses the movement animation. A use case is when you want to play a different animation then walking while the object may still move.
        See Also:
        playMovementAnimation()

        public void playMovementAnimation()
